DataElement.preferredName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire Past Seven Days Health Problems Affect Ability to do Regular Daily Activities Other than Work at Job Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how much their health problems affected their ability to do regular daily activities, other than work at a job, in the past seven days, using an 11 point visual analogue scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire Past Week Health Problems Affect Ability to do Regular Daily Activities other than Work at Job Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The second version of a standardized survey originally developed by Margaret C. Reilly in 1993 which is used to evaluate the extent to which a patient's general health problems effects their ability to work and perform daily activities. This instrument consists of 6 questions which can be completed by the patient or in an interview format._The most recent week, including today._A question about how much an individual's health problems affects or affected their ability to do regular daily activities other than work at a job._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The second version of a standardized survey originally developed by Margaret C. Reilly in 1993 which is used to evaluate the extent to which a patient's general health problems effects their ability to work and perform daily activities. This instrument consists of 6 questions which can be completed by the patient or in an interview format.

Concepts.longName: Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: The second version of a standardized survey originally developed by Margaret C. Reilly in 1993 which is used to evaluate the extent to which a patient's general health problems effects their ability to work and perform daily activities. This instrument consists of 6 questions which can be completed by the patient or in an interview format.

Property.preferredName: Past Week Health Problems Affect Ability to do Regular Daily Activities other than Work at Job Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about how much an individual's health problems affects or affected their ability to do regular daily activities other than work at a job.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Health Problems Affect Ability to do Regular Daily Activities other than Work at Job
Concepts.definition: A question about how much an individual's health problems affects or affected their ability to do regular daily activities other than work at a job.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: WPAI-GH:Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire-General Health V2.0. Reilly MC, Zbrozek AS, Dukes EM., 1993.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NRG study CC003 in Rave per request by R.Bonanni. mc 8/28/15

ValueDomain.preferredName: WPAI Effect of Health Problems on Daily Activities 11 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used in the Work Productivity and Activity Impairment General Health V2.0 Questionnaire with values ranging from 0: Health problems had no effect on my daily activities to 10: Health problems completely prevented me from doing my daily activities.
